intro: Botrychium sutchuanense, commonly known as the Sichuan moonwort, is a fern native to China. It belongs to the family Ophioglossaceae and is characterized by its unique morphology, featuring a fleshy, spore-bearing sorus. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are usually lanceolate and have a distinctive, intricate venation pattern. Botrychium sutchuanense is of interest to botanists due to its primitive features and ecological significance in its habitat.
